info.title: OpenAPI for Query and Execution API
info.description: API for Querying and Reading Dune Data

post.description: Execute, or run a query for the specified query ID

parameters.name: X-DUNE-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key for the service

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API Key for the service, alternative to using the HTTP header X-DUNE-API-KEY.

parameters.name: query_id
parameters.description: unique identifier of the query

parameters.name: performance
parameters.description: The performance engine tier the execution will be run on. Can be either medium or large. Medium consumes 10 credits, and large consumes 20 credits, per run. Default is medium.

parameters.name: query_parameters
parameters.description: SQL Query parameters in key-value pairs. Each parameter is to be provided in key-value pairs. This enables you to execute a parameterized query with the provided values for your parameter keys. Partial submission of parameters is allowed. For example, if the query expects three parameters and you only pass in two, the third one will automatically use its default value as defined in the Query Parameter Editor page.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be processed by the server due to malformed syntax or validation failure.

example.error: This api request would exceed your configured limits per billing cycle. Please visit your settings on dune.com and adjust your limits to continue usage.
Not allowed to execute query. Query is archived, unsaved or not enough permissions.

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request.

post.description: Cancel a triggered execution request given the execution ID

parameters.name: X-DUNE-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key for the service

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API Key for the service, alternative to using the HTTP header X-DUNE-API-KEY.

parameters.name: execution_id
parameters.description: unique identifier of the execution

example.error: The requested execution ID (ID: "01HKZSP2CQHJY17BPVDF91T925") is invalid.
The requested execution ID (ID 01HKZS6KF0TDBPVJHHK9T5FDEN) was not found.

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request.

get.description: Check the status of an execution request

parameters.name: X-DUNE-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key for the service

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API Key for the service, alternative to using the HTTP header X-DUNE-API-KEY.

parameters.name: execution_id
parameters.description: unique identifier of the execution

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or validation failure.

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request.

get.description: Given a query ID, returns the latest executed result of a query on Dune

parameters.name: X-DUNE-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key for the service

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API Key for the service, alternative to using the HTTP header X-DUNE-API-KEY.

parameters.name: query_id
parameters.description: unique identifier of the query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit number of rows to return. This together with 'offset' allows easy pagination through results in an incremental and efficient way.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset row number to start (inclusive, first row means offset=0) returning results from. This together with 'limit' allows easy pagination through results in an incremental and efficient way.

parameters.name: query_parameters
parameters.description: SQL Query parameters in key-value pairs. Each parameter is to be provided in key-value pairs. This enables you to execute a parameterized query with the provided values for your parameter keys. Partial submission of parameters is allowed. For example, if the query expects three parameters and you only pass in two, the third one will automatically use its default value as defined in the Query Parameter Editor page.

parameters.name: ignore_max_datapoints_per_request
parameters.description: There is a default 250,000 datapoints limit to make sure you don't accidentally spend all your credits in one call. To ignore the max limit, you can add ignore_max_datapoints_per_request=true

parameters.name: allow_partial_results
parameters.description: This enables returning a query result that was too large and only a partial result is available. By default allow_partial_results is set to false and a failed state is returned.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or validation failure.

example.error: This api request would exceed your configured limits per billing cycle. Please visit your settings on dune.com and adjust your limits to continue usage.

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request. It may include errors such as failure in core API execution, invalid query parameters, or issues with the customer data provided.

get.description: Given a query ID, returns the latest executed result of a query on Dune in CSV format

parameters.name: X-DUNE-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key for the service

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API Key for the service, alternative to using the HTTP header X-DUNE-API-KEY.

parameters.name: query_id
parameters.description: unique identifier of the query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit number of rows to return. This together with 'offset' allows easy pagination through results in an incremental and efficient way.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset row number to start (inclusive, first row means offset=0) returning results from. This together with 'limit' allows easy pagination through results in an incremental and efficient way.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: SQL Query parameters in key-value pairs. Each parameter is to be provided in key-value pairs. This enables you to execute a parameterized query with the provided values for your parameter keys. Partial submission of parameters is allowed. For example, if the query expects three parameters and you only pass in two, the third one will automatically use its default value as defined in the Query Parameter Editor page.

parameters.name: ignore_max_datapoints_per_request
parameters.description: There is a default 250,000 datapoints limit to make sure you don't accidentally spend all your credits in one call. To ignore the max limit, you can add ignore_max_datapoints_per_request=true

parameters.name: allow_partial_results
parameters.description: This enables returning a query result that was too large and only a partial result is available. By default allow_partial_results is set to false and a failed state is returned.

x-dune-next-offset.description: Offset to use to retrieve the next page of results if available.

x-dune-next-uri.description: URI to retrieve the next page of results if available.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or validation failure.

example.error: This api request would exceed your configured limits per billing cycle. Please visit your settings on dune.com and adjust your limits to continue usage.

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request. It may include errors such as failure in core API execution, invalid query parameters, or issues with the customer data provided.

This api request would exceed your configured limits per billing cycle. Please visit your settings on dune.com and adjust your limits to continue usage.
Query state is not QUERY_STATE_COMPLETED, cannot provide CSV Result

500.description: Internal server error occurred. This usually happens due to unexpected issues in processing the request. It may include errors such as failure in core API execution, invalid query parameters, or issues with the customer data provided.

execution_id.description: Unique identifier for the execution of the query.

state.description: The state of the query execution.

is_execution_finished.description: Whether the state of the query execution is terminal. This can be used for polling purposes.

submitted_at.description: Timestamp of when the query was submitted.

expires_at.description: Timestamp of when the query result expires.

execution_started_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution started.

execution_ended_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution ended.

cancelled_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution was cancelled, if applicable.

next_offset.description: Offset that can be used to retrieve the next page of results.

next_uri.description: URI that can be used to fetch the next page of results.

execution_id.description: Unique identifier for the execution of the query and corresponding result.

state.description: The state of the query execution.

is_execution_finished.description: Whether the state of the query execution is terminal. This can be used for polling purposes.

submitted_at.description: Timestamp of when the query was submitted.

expires_at.description: Timestamp of when the query result expires.

execution_started_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution started.

execution_ended_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution ended.

cancelled_at.description: Timestamp of when the query execution was cancelled, if applicable.

type.description: The type of error that occurred.

message.description: A descriptive message about the error.

QueryResultRows.description: A list of rows. A row is dictionary of key-value pairs returned by the query, each pair corresponding to a column

line.description: The line number at which the syntax error occurred.

column.description: The column number at which the syntax error occurred.

ExecutionResultMetadata.description: Metadata about the execution of the query, including details like column names, row counts, and execution times.

column_names.description: Names of the columns in the result set.

result_set_bytes.description: Number of bytes in the result set for the current page of results.

row_count.description: Number of rows in the result set for the current page of results.

total_result_set_bytes.description: Total number of bytes in the result set. This doesn't include the json representation overhead.

total_row_count.description: Total number of rows in the result set.

datapoint_count.description: The count of datapoints used for billing/pricing, based on the result set.

pending_time_millis.description: Time in milliseconds that the query was pending before execution.

execution_time_millis.description: Time in milliseconds that the query took to execute.

ParameterObject.description: SQL Query parameters in key-value pairs. Each parameter is to be provided in key-value pairs. This enables you to execute a parameterized query with the provided values for your parameter keys. Partial submission of parameters is allowed. For example, if the query expects three parameters and you only pass in two, the third one will automatically use its default value as defined in the Query Parameter Editor page.

Performance.description: The performance engine tier the execution will be run on. Can be either medium or large. Medium consumes 10 credits, and large consumes 20 credits, per run. Default is medium.

error.description: 401 unauthorized error for invalid API key
404 error message for resource not found
400: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or validation failure.

InternalServerError.description: 500: Generic error message, given when an unexpected condition is encountered and no more specific message is available. Please consult the API documentation for more details.
